name: AdvancementProgressHelper
description: The `AdvancementProgressHelper` class is a World Interaction helper class in JSMacros that provides access to Minecraft advancement progress information. This class allows you to track, query, and analyze the completion status of advancements and their specific criteria in your scripts. Since JSMacros 1.8.4, this class has been available to help scripters monitor advancement progress, check completion status, and retrieve detailed information about advancement criteria.

methods.name: isDone
methods.description: Returns `true` if the advancement is completely finished (all requirements met), `false` otherwise.

methods.name: isAnyObtained
methods.description: Returns `true` if any criteria has already been met, `false` if no criteria have been completed.

methods.name: getPercentage
methods.description: Returns the percentage of finished requirements as a value between 0.0 and 1.0.
examples:
const percent = Math.round(progress.getPercentage() * 100);
Chat.log(`Advancement is ${percent}% complete`);

methods.name: getFraction
methods.description: Returns a TextHelper containing the fraction of finished requirements to total requirements (e.g., "3/5").

methods.name: countObtainedRequirements
methods.description: Returns the number of requirements criteria that have been obtained.

methods.name: getCriteria
methods.description: Returns a map containing all criteria names and their completion timestamps (in milliseconds since epoch). Only includes criteria that have been completed.

methods.name: getObtainedCriteria
methods.description: Returns an array of criteria IDs that have been completed.

methods.name: getUnobtainedCriteria
methods.description: Returns an array of criteria IDs that have not yet been completed.

methods.name: getRequirements
methods.description: Returns all requirements of this advancement. The structure is a 2D array where each inner array represents a set of criteria where only one needs to be completed (OR logic).

methods.name: getCriterionProgress
methods.description: Returns the completion timestamp of the given criteria in milliseconds since epoch, or `-1` if the criteria is not met yet.

methods.name: isCriteriaObtained
methods.description: Returns `true` if the given criteria is met, `false` otherwise.

methods.name: getEarliestProgressObtainDate
methods.description: Returns the earliest completion date (timestamp in milliseconds since epoch) of all criteria.
examples:
const earliestDate = new Date(progress.getEarliestProgressObtainDate());
Chat.log(`First criteria completed on ${earliestDate.toLocaleDateString()}`);
